sentence.idiomatic: He just went to Shanghai.
Did he just come? Yes.
Ms. Wang just got off work.
Mr. Wang just moved to the United States.
Where did Mr. Li move to? He moved to Shanghai.
Did she move into her boyfriend's place? Yes.
What suggestions do you have?
Mr. Wang's suggestion is not bad.
What is his suggestion?
Besides the department store, there's also a supermarket here.
In addition to Mr. Wang, Ms. Zhang is also going.
What else do we want to buy besides apples?
Department stores are the best places to buy gifts.
A bar is the place most suitable for get-togethers.
Airplanes are the fastest transportation for travel.
That supermarket is both big and clean.
Ms. Li is both pretty and smart.
The subway is both fast and cheap.
Riding the subway really saves time.
I want to save money.
You won't save money shopping at department stores.
He is definitely going to Hong Kong.
Are you coming for sure? Yes.
Mr. Wang will definitely not go shopping at a department store.
This price is not reasonable.
Is his price reasonable? It's all right.
The supermarket's prices are very reasonable.
This place is not only pretty, but also clean.
Riding the subway to work is not only fast, but also saves money.
Not only will Ms. Wang come, but her boyfriend will come as well.
Can you give me a discount?

word.literal: 70 percent (discounted to 30 percent of original price)

sentence.idiomatic: Is this on sale? Yes, 70% off.
We don't give discounts here.
I’ve just moved here. I don’t know where to go shopping. Do you have any good suggestions?
In this area, there is a supermarket in addition to the department store. I think the supermarket is the most convenient place to buy things. When I want to buy things, I go there.
That’s great. If I want to buy something, I’ll go there, too.
Yes. That market is big and clean. There are lots of things inside. Shopping there can not only save you time, but also money as their prices are reasonable. They also often have discounts.
OK. I’ll certainly go to the supermarket to buy things. Thanks for your suggestions.

word.literal: to know sth. or sb. well
